title: Damage formula
data:
- *This page is a **[stub](/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. You could probably [expand this page](http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Damage_formula\&action=edit) should you wish to do so.*

There isn't a single, general purpose **damage formula**, but different types of damage have different means of calculating damage.

In general, damage can be calculated as `[(Raw Damage) - (Damage Reduction)] * (Chance to hit)` over an action's given speed.

### Raw Damage[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- **[Weapon damage](/Weapon_damage "Weapon damage"):** which covers damage calculation for player [weapons](/Weapon "Weapon"), [unarmed combat](/Unarmed_combat "Unarmed combat"), and [throwing](/Throwing "Throwing").

- **Spell damage:** Most [spells](/Spell "Spell"), [wands](/Wand "Wand"), and monster abilities deal damage in [dice notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dice_notation), and deal `nD( (Spellpower * multiplier / divisor) + constant)`. Spellpower is determined by skill (and for monsters, [HD](/HD "HD")). Each spell has its own multiplier, divisor, and constant. See a spell's own page for more details.

  - If the dice has a non-integer amount of sides, it is *often* rounded in a weighted manner. That is, 1d1.25 has a 25% chance to be 1d2 and a 75% chance to be 1d1. However, this varies on a case-by-case basis; sometimes dice round down or round to the nearest integer.
  - Certain spells like [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter") may further be multiplied by external factors.
  - By default, spells check [AC](/AC "AC") and [EV](/EV "EV"). Some may ignore one or the other, or both.

- **[Poison](/Poison#Poisoned_Condition "Poison")** deals damage over time. The more poison you receive, the more the poison "stacks", and the faster you take damage.

- Certain effects like [Agony](/Agony "Agony"), [Torment](/Torment "Torment"), and [flay](/Flay "Flay") are percentages of your maximum health.

Damage from monsters is unknown(?), but their maximum damage is displayed on examination.

***

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) not to be confused with weapons' base damage

### Other Factors

- **[To-hit](/To-hit "To-hit"):** Determines accuracy (chance *to-hit*) of an attack. Some attacks can't miss, which is an infinite to-hit.
- **[Weapon speed](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed")**: Determines how [fast](/Delay "Delay") you swing/fire a weapon or fists. Most [spells](/Spell "Spell") have a delay of 1.0.

### Damage Reduction

- **[Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")** reduce damage of a [specific type](/Damage_type "Damage type"). Player and monster resistances are not symmetrical.
- **[Armour class](/Armour_class "Armour class") (AC)** will reduce most attacks by (0 to AC) damage.
  - Physical attacks in melee against the player are affected by [guaranteed damage reduction](/Guaranteed_damage_reduction "Guaranteed damage reduction") (GDR), which increase the minimum AC roll.
- **[Evasion](/Evasion "Evasion") score (EV)** determines how likely you are to dodge an avoidable attack completely. See [Evasion#To-hit\_versus\_EV](/Evasion#To-hit_versus_EV "Evasion") for formulas.
- **[Shield](/Shield "Shield") score (SH)** determines how likely you are to block an attack completely. Melee attacks, ranged attacks, and certain projectile-like spells can be blocked. See [Shields#Blocking](/Shields#Blocking "Shields") for formulas

Damage formula

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
This page is a stub. You could probably expand this page should you wish to do so.

There isn't a single, general purpose damage formula, but different types of damage have different means of calculating damage.

In general, damage can be calculated as [(Raw Damage) - (Damage Reduction)] * (Chance to hit) over an action's given speed.

Raw Damage[1]

  • Weapon damage: which covers damage calculation for player weapons, unarmed combat, and throwing.
  • Spell damage: Most spells, wands, and monster abilities deal damage in dice notation, and deal nD( (Spellpower * multiplier / divisor) + constant). Spellpower is determined by skill (and for monsters, HD). Each spell has its own multiplier, divisor, and constant. See a spell's own page for more details.
    • If the dice has a non-integer amount of sides, it is often rounded in a weighted manner. That is, 1d1.25 has a 25% chance to be 1d2 and a 75% chance to be 1d1. However, this varies on a case-by-case basis; sometimes dice round down or round to the nearest integer.
    • Certain spells like Shatter may further be multiplied by external factors.
    • By default, spells check AC and EV. Some may ignore one or the other, or both.
  • Poison deals damage over time. The more poison you receive, the more the poison "stacks", and the faster you take damage.
  • Certain effects like Agony, Torment, and flay are percentages of your maximum health.

Damage from monsters is unknown(?), but their maximum damage is displayed on examination.

  1. ↑ not to be confused with weapons' base damage

Other Factors

  • To-hit: Determines accuracy (chance to-hit) of an attack. Some attacks can't miss, which is an infinite to-hit.
  • Weapon speed: Determines how fast you swing/fire a weapon or fists. Most spells have a delay of 1.0.

Damage Reduction

  • Resistances reduce damage of a specific type. Player and monster resistances are not symmetrical.
  • Armour class (AC) will reduce most attacks by (0 to AC) damage.
    • Physical attacks in melee against the player are affected by guaranteed damage reduction (GDR), which increase the minimum AC roll.
  • Evasion score (EV) determines how likely you are to dodge an avoidable attack completely. See Evasion#To-hit_versus_EV for formulas.
  • Shield score (SH) determines how likely you are to block an attack completely. Melee attacks, ranged attacks, and certain projectile-like spells can be blocked. See Shields#Blocking for formulas
